content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia, which takes a single argument `str::String`, and wraps the text into lines with a maximum width of 10 characters:

```julia
function wrap_string(str)
    text_width = 10
    line = ""
    words = split(str, ' ')
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            println(line)
            line = string(word)
        else
            line *= string(word) * " "
        end
    end
    println(line)
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog")
"The"
"quick"
"brown"
"fox"
"jumps"
"over"
"the"
"lazy"
"dog"
```
